content:
A few days ago, the emoji reaction hovercard started to be unavailable in Chromium, Google Chrome as well as the Electron desktop app for me (at least on Linux). I move the mouse to hover over the button but nothing is shown up. It works fine in Firefox. Does anyone else have this issue? It worked for a while even after the Zulip update, so that's not the cause.
Also, I remembered a related issue: Chromium also won't show the reaction list on GitHub if the mouse is hovered over the emoji button, unless I log in and (right) click it. The same works fine in Firefox too, but this is a consistent issue for me, not started to happen a few days ago.

well as the Electron desktop app for me

same here, it looks like there isn't a github issue for this yet
though it now seems to work again for me :shock:
nm, it only works on one of my machines :sweat_smile:
can't even tell which difference between the two could cause this
should be the same os version and mostly the same setup :thinking: though there are some differences
Hmm, https://chat.zulip.org/ does not have this issue... tada.png

Also it works fine for me here (and also in GitHub) in Chromium 92.0.4486.0 (758529b50f12de596dca6c0fe6409cba8c37597d).
I assume this is a Chromium bug that has been fixed recently.

FWIW I've found it's fixed in https://github.com/chromium/chromium/compare/1b2016cf626738b4617a0b5def8764776c210eec...0bcac0bd2815e21ebee941b8adb41dc53b90f41a.
It also works (without updating) if I enable native Wayland support.
